import React, { useState } from "react"; export const TableNeswsletter = () => { const [neswsletterList, setNeswsletterList] = useState ([ { "newsletterId": 5, "newsletterTypeId": 1, "newsletterName": "BigBang", "newsletterDescription": "It's about your art, not about you.", "newsletterAttach": "artToday.png", "sentDate": "2022-10-29T19:14:03.477155", "sentEstatus": 1, "creationDate": "2022-10-29T18:22:09.054873" } , { "newsletterId": 6, "newsletterTypeId": 2, "newsletterName": "Motivational Sports", "newsletterDescription": "If you love the game, you know it takes true dedication.", "newsletterAttach": "sportMessages.png", "sentDate": null, "sentEstatus": 0, "creationDate": "2022-10-29T22:58:26.893728" } ]); return ( <> { neswsletterList.map( neswsletter => ( )) }
Actions Name Attach Creation Date Sent Date Estatus
{neswsletter.newsletterName} {neswsletter.newsletterAttach} {neswsletter.creationDate} {neswsletter.sentDate} {neswsletter.sentEstatus}
); };
